In the event of a failover, Cloudflare sets a new __cflb cookie to direct future requests to the failover pool.

This allows you to write rules that match valid or invalid sequences. The specific cookies used to validate sequences are called sequence cookies.

knowledges.comment: Hotjar cookie. This cookie is set once a visitor completes a poll using the Feedback Poll widget. It is used to ensure that the same poll does not re-appear if it has already been filled in.

knowledges.name: _hjMinimizedPolls

knowledges.name: _hjTLDTest
knowledges.comment: When the Hotjar script executes we try to determine the most generic cookie path we should use, instead of the page hostname. This is done so that cookies can be shared across subdomains (where applicable). To determine this, we try to store the _hjTLDTest cookie for different URL substring alternatives until it fails. After this check, the cookie is removed.

knowledges.name: _hjUserAttributesHash
knowledges.comment: User Attributes sent through the Hotjar Identify API are cached for the duration of the session in order to know when an attribute has changed and needs to be updated.

knowledges.name: _hjCachedUserAttributes
knowledges.comment: This cookie stores User Attributes which are sent through the Hotjar Identify API, whenever the user is not in the sample. These attributes will only be saved if the user interacts with a Hotjar Feedback tool.

knowledges.name: _hjLocalStorageTest
knowledges.comment: This cookie is used to check if the Hotjar Tracking Script can use local storage. If it can, a value of 1 is set in this cookie. The data stored in_hjLocalStorageTest has no expiration time, but it is deleted immediately after creating it so the expected storage time is under 100ms.

knowledges.name: _hjptid
knowledges.comment: This cookie is set for logged in users of Hotjar, who have Admin Team Member permissions. It is used during pricing experiments to show the Admin consistent pricing across the site.

knowledges.name: _hjAbsoluteSessionInProgress
knowledges.comment: The cookie is set so Hotjar can track the beginning of the user's journey for a total session count. It does not contain any identifiable information.

knowledges.name: _hjFirstSeen
knowledges.comment: The cookie is set so Hotjar can track the beginning of the user's journey for a total session count. It does not contain any identifiable information.

knowledges.name: _hjIncludedInPageviewSample
knowledges.comment: This cookie is set to let Hotjar know whether that visitor is included in the data sampling defined by your site's page view limit.

knowledges.name: _hjIncludedInSessionSample
knowledges.comment: This cookie is set to let Hotjar know whether that visitor is included in the data sampling defined by your site's daily session limit

knowledges.name: _hjSession_
knowledges.comment: A cookie that holds the current session data. This ensues that subsequent requests within the session window will be attributed to the same Hotjar session.

knowledges.name: _hjSessionUser_
knowledges.comment: Hotjar cookie that is set when a user first lands on a page with the Hotjar script. It is used to persist the Hotjar User ID, unique to that site on the browser. This ensures that behavior in subsequent visits to the same site will be attributed to the same user ID.

knowledges.name: _hjSessionTooLarge
knowledges.comment: Causes Hotjar to stop collecting data if a session becomes too large. This is determined automatically by a signal from the WebSocket server if the session size exceeds the limit.

knowledges.name: _hjSessionRejected
knowledges.comment: If present, this cookie will be set to 1 for the duration of a user’s session, if Hotjar rejected the session from connecting to our WebSocket due to server overload. This cookie is only applied in extremely rare situations to prevent severe performance issues.

knowledges.name: _hjSessionResumed
knowledges.comment: A cookie that is set when a session/recording is reconnected to Hotjar servers after a break in connection.

knowledges.name: hjViewportId
knowledges.comment: This cookie stores user viewport details such as size and dimensions.

knowledges.name: _hjSessionStorageTest
knowledges.comment: This cookie checks if the Hotjar Tracking Code can use Session Storage. If it can, a value of 1 is set.

knowledges.name: _hjCookieTest
knowledges.comment: This cookie checks to see if the Hotjar Tracking Code can use cookies. If it can, a value of 1 is set.

knowledges.name: ac_enable_tracking

knowledges.comment: PubMatic UserId. this identifier to identify each user uniquely. Some of the uses of this anonymous identifier are to support frequency capping, perform UID sync ups with DSP's, DMP's. DMP's / DP's push audicne data against this ID. API publishers sends this ID while making API requests to PubMatic AdServer. UAS Ad Engine also uses this cookie for FCAP purposes.

Existence of this cookie means that current flow of the execution should not generate PubMatic userId cookie, as its already being set by other flow which has set KCCH.

knowledges.name: DPSync

API publishers sends this ID while making API requests to PubMatic AdServer. UAS Ad Engine also uses this cookie for FCAP purposes.

knowledges.name: OptanonConsent
knowledges.comment: This cookie is set by the cookie compliance solution from OneTrust. It stores information about the categories of cookies the site uses and whether visitors have given or withdrawn consent for the use of each category. This enables site owners to prevent cookies in each category from being set in the user’s browser, when consent is not given. The cookie has a normal lifespan of one year, so that returning visitors to the site will have their preferences remembered. It contains no information that can identify the site visitor.

knowledges.comment: This cookie is used to help record the visitor's use of the website. It is used to collect statistics about site usage such as when the visitor last visited the site. This information is then used to improve the user experience on the website. This Siteimprove Analytics cookie contains a randomly generated ID used to recognize the browser when a visitor reads a page. The cookie contains no personal information and is used only for web analytics. It is also used to track the sequence of pages a visitor looks at during a visit to the site. This information can be used to reduce user journeys, and enable visitors to find relevant information quicker.

knowledges.name: __Host-ERIC_PROD-
knowledges.comment: Enterprise Request Infrastructure Cookie (ERIC) carries the cross-site request forgery (CSRF) security token between the server and the client. The cookie name indicates the server mode (PROD or PRODDEBUG) and a random number. A different token is generated for each Lightning app.

knowledges.name: SetupDomainProbePassed
knowledges.comment: Indicates whether the web client successfully accessed the new *.salesforce-setup.com domain. If the cookie value is true, then Setup pages are served from *.salesforce-setup.com. If false, Setup pages are served from *.force.com. In this case, users are sometimes required to view Setup pages in Salesforce Classic instead of in Lightning Experience.

knowledges.name: JSESSIONID
knowledges.comment: JSESSIONID is a cookie generated by Servlet containers and used for session management in J2EE web applications for HTTP protocol. If a Web server is using a cookie for session management, it creates and sends JSESSIONID cookie to the client and then the client sends it back to the server in subsequent HTTP requests. JSESSIONID is a platform session cookie and is used by sites with JavaServer Pages (JSP). The cookie is used to maintain an anonymous user session by the server.

knowledges.name: SSLB

The user can access their conversations and have data communicated on logged-out pages for 1 week, as long as the session isn't intentionally terminated with Intercom('shutdown');, which usually happens on logout.

knowledges.name: intercom-device-id-

The value of these cookies is an identifier that is used to retrieve information about a user’s logged-in session in the Website / App Insights Portal. It is important to note that this cookie is only set for users of the Qualtrics product (not your website visitors).

knowledges.comment: Used to determine whether or not we should display a survey on repeated user visits within a period

knowledges.name: QSI_S_
knowledges.comment: Used to track visits and sampling rate set in the survey

knowledges.name: QST
knowledges.comment: Qualtrics surveys will add a persistent cookie (QST) that is used to prevent the same person from taking the same survey multiple times. Website / App Insights also uses this cookie to evaluate “survey has been taken” logic in action sets. See the Submitting Survey Sessions section for more information on how this cookie works.

knowledges.name: QSIPopUnder_PopUnderTarget_SI_
knowledges.comment: It helps Qualtrics prevent displaying another pop under if there is already one. This prevents multiple windows from crowding a site visitor

knowledges.name: QSI_CT
knowledges.comment: This cookie is used for tracking events. It has a counter of each event and the number of times that event has occurred. For instance, if there are 2 different events that you are tracking.

knowledges.name: QSI_DATA
knowledges.comment: This cookie is used for cookie storage and will only be set if both session and local storage do not exist. It is extremely rare that session storage is not set in the browser window. QSI_DATA is rarely used.

knowledges.name: QSI_ReplaySession_Throttled_
knowledges.comment: This cookie is used to stop session creation and recording due to an encountered error. This value is a boolean. This cookie is ignored if it is a test session.

knowledges.name: QSI_ReplaySession_SampledOut_
knowledges.comment: This cookie is used to stop session creation due to the session being sampled-out. The sampling percentage is determined by the sample rate set in your session replay settings. This value is a boolean. This cookie is ignored if it is a test session.

knowledges.name: Site History
knowledges.comment: This cookie tracks the URLs of the web pages that the user visited. The pages must have the site intercept code snippet for tracking to work. By default, the maximum size is 2000 bytes, but you can specify a different size in your intercept settings.

knowledges.name: c-referrer
knowledges.comment: We use cookies to understand who referred users to our Website to support our referral program and provide referral discounts. We do not store user identifiable information in these cookies.

knowledges.name: c-signup
knowledges.comment: We use cookies to understand who referred users to our Website to support our referral program and provide referral discounts. We do not store user identifiable information in these cookies.

knowledges.name: c-plan
knowledges.comment: We use cookies to understand who referred users to our Website to support our referral program and provide referral discounts. We do not store user identifiable information in these cookies.

knowledges.name: cognito.services.a
knowledges.comment: We use cookies to identify the user session when users log in to use the Website. This cookie is required for the secure operation of our Services.

knowledges.name: cognito.organization
knowledges.comment: We use cookies to identify the user session when users log in to use the Website. This cookie is required for the secure operation of our Services.

knowledges.name: rdtrk
knowledges.comment: Save a list of all pages that the visitor accessed within your domain, even before conversion (only for accounts with access to Lead Tracking).

knowledges.name: _rdtrk
knowledges.comment: Save a list of all pages that the visitor accessed within your domain, even before conversion (only for accounts with access to Lead Tracking).

knowledges.name: _rd_experiment_version

knowledges.name: _form_fields

knowledges.name: _rdlps_pp

knowledges.name: _rd_wa_first_session
knowledges.comment: Save the website from which the visitor first accessed.

knowledges.name: _sp_wa_first_session

knowledges.name: _rd_wa_id
knowledges.comment: Save information regarding the existence of a session in progress, to differentiate visits.

knowledges.name: _sp_wa_id
knowledges.comment: Save information regarding the existence of a session in progress, to differentiate visits.

knowledges.name: _rd_wa_ses_id
knowledges.comment: Store the visitor's unique identifier, the time it was created, the visit count, the current time, the time of the last visit and the session id.

knowledges.name: _sp_wa_ses_id
knowledges.comment: Store the visitor's unique identifier, the time it was created, the visit count, the current time, the time of the last visit and the session id.

knowledges.name: _sp_root_domain_test_

knowledges.comment: This cookie can be set using a language switcher and then when a user comes back to the site it will leverage the locale specified in the cookie when redirecting from / to the correct locale location.

knowledges.name: b925d32c
knowledges.comment: Indicates if a user is logged in or not.

knowledges.name: ssoCSRFCookie
knowledges.comment: Serves as cross-site request forgery (CSRF) protection when moving between servlets in SSO.

knowledges.name: p23mn32t
knowledges.comment: Contains a unique Base32 identifier that indicates to SSO that a user is logging in from a new device. The identifier is created based on the user login, browser, and user agent.

knowledges.name: l34kn6no
knowledges.comment: Stores the OpenID state when SSO acts as a relying party, for example, for signing in with Microsoft using OpenID.

knowledges.name: iu2g34bw
knowledges.comment: Stores the OpenID code_verifier when SSO acts as a relying party, for example, for signing in with Microsoft using OpenID.

knowledges.name: a69k21bb
knowledges.comment: Stores redirect_uri upon successful sign-in when SSO acts as a relying party, for example, for signing in with Microsoft using OpenID.

knowledges.name: cgq80xhu
knowledges.comment: Contains an SHA-256 hash of a random UUID. When a user signs in via OpenID, this cookie is used to track the session state via the SSO OpenID iFrame and perform frontend logout if necessary.

knowledges.name: 72ddbc27
knowledges.comment: Added when a user selects the Remember me option to store their credentials. Thanks to this option, the user doesn't have to provide their credentials again when the session expires, and the user is logged in automatically.

knowledges.name: kj76fg4h
knowledges.comment: Prevents the user from becoming stuck following a failed federated login if the user selected the Remember me option to store their credentials. If the user is signed in, this cookie is deleted.

knowledges.name: tc_cj_v2
knowledges.comment: Used for user customer journey storage for TMS deduplication (channel and source storage).

knowledges.name: tc_cj_v2_cmp.
knowledges.comment: Used for user customer journey storage for TMS deduplication (campaign storage).

knowledges.name: tc_cj_v2_med
knowledges.comment: Used for user customer journey storage for TMS deduplication (medium storage).

knowledges.name: tc_test_cookie
knowledges.comment: Cookie linked to the display of the privacy banner, it allows to check whether cookies can be deposited and not to redisplay the consent banner when consent is given. Deposited then disappears, cannot be deleted. Technical cookie (exempted)

knowledges.name: TCIPD
knowledges.comment: Used to identify visitors exposed to the privacy banner. CMP Commanders Act uses this cookie to measure statistics for privacy banner usage until visitors provide consent for the TCID cookie. With this 2-cookie system, CMP Commanders Act is the only CMP that has been granted the right of exemption from consent for statistical measurement by the French CNIL

knowledges.name: TC_PRIVACY
knowledges.comment: Used for user status storage (optin or optout) and Privacy banner display.

knowledges.name: TC_PRIVACY_CENTER
knowledges.comment: Used to display the optin/optout categories in the Privacy Center if the user re-open it.

knowledges.name: TC_OUTPUT
knowledges.comment: Used for user status storage (optin or optout) and Privacy banner display.

knowledges.name: TC_OUTPUT_categories
knowledges.comment: Used to display the optin/optout categories in the Privacy Center if the user re-open it.

knowledges.name: CAID
knowledges.comment: The CAID is the user identifier for cookie 1st

knowledges.name: TCID
knowledges.comment: Visitor identifier used to compute deduplicated statistics per user (for campaign and on-site tracking, segmentation, ...). CMP Commanders Act uses this cookie to measure statistics for privacy banner performance after a visitor provided consent. Before users provided consent CMP Commanders Act uses the TCPID cookie to measure anonymous statistics for privacy banner.

knowledges.name: WID
knowledges.comment: Used to identify when the browser is closed in order to split page views into multiple functional sessions.

knowledges.name: tc_sample_
knowledges.comment: Used for visitor and session sampling in the TMSCommander rules.

knowledges.name: TMS
knowledges.comment: Used when the deduplication is based on CAMPAIGN tracking (so the CAMPAIGN tracking is taken into account and not the landing page tracking)

knowledges.name: TC_CHECK_COOKIES_SUPPORT

knowledges.name: TCSESSION
knowledges.comment: Used to calculate CAMPAIGN metrics based on the session.

knowledges.name: TCREDIRECT
knowledges.comment: Used to deduplicate clicks (if redirect, just store the page view and ignore the click).

knowledges.name: TCLANDINGURL
knowledges.comment: Used to store landing page URL for CAMPAIGN raw data.

knowledges.name: TCAUDIENCE
knowledges.comment: Used to store the user segment for user targeting.

knowledges.name: _TCCookieSync
knowledges.comment: Used to store the date of the last cookie synchronisation with the partner (set in local storage by default, and cookie if local storage not available).

knowledges.name: pxid
knowledges.comment: Typically, it is enabled when a Publisher owned multiple domains and has an interest in identifying their users consistently across their domains. The URL of the referrer header has to match a pre-configured list of domains (configured in the Permutive dashboard). We refer to this service as the “Secure Permutive 3P cookie”, and will not be shared between Publishers. This PXID 3P cookie varies Publisher by Publisher.

knowledges.name: permutive-id
knowledges.comment: This ID is the same within a domain (not publisher-specific). The Permutive ID exists in all environments, including 3P cookie-blocked environments like Safari and Firefox. The ID is persistent for a user as long as the local storage isn’t refreshed on the user's device.

knowledges.name: cs
knowledges.comment: Used to store the user consent status for the current domain.

knowledges.name: vst
knowledges.comment: Used to store the user user intereset

knowledges.name: _u

knowledges.name: tf_respondent_cc

knowledges.name: attribution_user_id

knowledges.name: _hp2_ses_props
